content:
Mofungo
Mofungo was a New York City based band that was active from 1979-1993.{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://ny.eater.com/archives/2013/06/sietsemas_fond_farewell_to_nightlife_legend_maxwells.php", "title": "Sietsema's Fond Farewell to Nightlife Legend Maxwell's - Sietsema - Eater NY", "date": "2013-06-06", "publisher": "Ny.eater.com"} It featured guitarist Elliott Sharp and future food blogger Robert Sietsema. Robert Christgau described their last album as "basically unlistenable unless you grant it your full attention".{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name=Mofungo", "title": "CG: Mofungo", "publisher": "Robert Christgau"} The New York Times described them as "not your typical rock and roll band".{"citetype": "web", "url": "https://www.nytimes.com/1987/04/03/arts/pop-jazz-raucous-rockers-add-a-message.html", "title": "Pop/Jazz; Raucous Rockers Add A Message - New York Times", "date": "1987-04-03", "publisher": "Nytimes.com", "author": "ROBERT PALMERPublished: April 03, 1987"}
